posts.post_content: How bout [Lantern Spirit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lantern Spirit)?
posts.html:
How bout Lantern Spirit?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Schlapatzjenc (12/20/2011 11:54:56 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This was a powerhouse back in the day. You newbies and your static combat damage. Back when combat damage used the stack, you could bounce this in response to combat damage to save it while still dealing two damage to whatever it was fighting. Pair that with [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) and the other powerful cards of the day, blue didn't really need anything else:  
Your opponent has [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel)? Fine, block with two of these, bounce them in response to combat damage and the Angel dies while these survive. That is, if you didn't counter the Angel in the first place.
posts.html:

Rating:

posts.post_content: @John: 2/1 or 2/2 is pretty irrelevant on this guy. It's rare because it is (or was) a win condition for blue decks. A cheap creature with evasion that is about impossible to kill, and that can block larger creatures all day long without dying.
posts.html:
@John: 2/1 or 2/2 is pretty irrelevant on this guy. It's rare because it is (or was) a win condition for blue decks. A cheap creature with evasion that is about impossible to kill, and that can block larger creatures all day long without dying.

Posted By: majinara (5/8/2010 12:49:36 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
"*can it stop cratures even with trample?*"  
-alexkano  
  
No, if you're using the ability in response to blockers, the blocked trample creature will still do its full power in damage to defending player.  
  
This is just a mediocre card now, It at least used to be combat tricks prior to the rules change.
